info.title: Resource Inventory Management
info.description: This is TMF Resource Inventory Management API specification for Access4.0

get.description: This operation list or find NetworkElements entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: For filtering on the base of 'category' field (equality)

parameters.name: endsz
parameters.description: For filtering on the base of 'endsz' field (equality)

parameters.name: fsz
parameters.description: For filtering on the base of 'fsz' field (equality)

parameters.name: networkElementGroupUuid
parameters.description: For filtering on the base of 'networkElementGroupUuid' field (equality)

parameters.name: vpsz
parameters.description: For filtering on the base of 'vpsz' field (equality)

X-Result-Count.description: Actual number of items returned in the response body

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

Attachment.description: Complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures...

id.description: Unique identifier for this particular attachment

href.description: URI for this Attachment

attachmentType.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

content.description: The actual contents of the attachment object, if embedded, encoded as base64

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

mimeType.description: Attachment mime type such as extension file for video, picture and document

name.description: The name of the attachment

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

validFor.description: The period of time for which the attachment is valid

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

name.description: Name of the related entity.

id.description: Unique identifier of the feature.

isBundle.description: True if this is a feature group. Default is false.

isEnabled.description: True if this feature is enabled. Default is true.

name.description: This is the name for the feature.

constraint.description: This is a list of feature constraints.

featureCharacteristic.description: This is a list of Characteristics for a particular feature.

name.description: This is the name of the target feature.

relationshipType.description: This is the type of the feature relationship.

validFor.description: The period for which this feature relationship is valid.

address.description: Human readable string of the address identified by the klsId.

klsId.description: KLS - Core Information Object (KIO) Locality Server - is a central reference data server for localities and network locations. It is the master system for holding and changing address and location reference data (also network mapping). See also: https://yam.telekom.de/docs/DOC-482263

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

LogicalResource.description: Logic resource is a type of resource that describes the common set of attributes shared by all concrete logical resources (e.g. TPE, MSISDN, IP Addresses) in the inventory.

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

category.description: Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

endOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date till the resource is operating

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

resourceVersion.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

startOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is operating

value.description: the value of the logical resource. E.g '0746712345' for  MSISDN's

administrativeState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

operationalState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

resourceStatus.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

usageState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

NetworkElementGroup.description:
NetworkElementGroup within Access 4.0 project
Skipped properties: activationFeature,attachment,note,place,resourceSpecification,value,startOperatingDate,endOperatingDate,administrativeState,resourceStatus,usageState,category,resourceVersion,relatedParty

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

creationTime.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

lastUpdateTime.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

partyId.description: This attribute defines the partyId of the requesting system.

specificationVersion.description: This attribute contains the version of the class specification.

type.description: This attribute identifies the type of the network element group.

lifecycleState.description: This attribute contains the lifecycle state of the network element group.

operationalState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

NetworkElementLink.description:
NetworkElementLink within Access 4.0 project
Skipped properties: activationFeature,attachment,note,place,resourceSpecification,value,startOperatingDate,endOperatingDate,administrativeState,resourceStatus,usageState,category,name,resourceVersion,relatedParty,networkElementPortUuid

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

creationTime.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

lastUpdateTime.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

lbz.description: Leitungsbezeichnung in Rebell  Die Leitungsbezeichnung (LBZ) bzw. die Leitungsbuchungsnummer (LBuNr) ist eine Zeichenkette, die sich aus der LSZ (92Z), der OrdNr (1), der LSZ-Erg (EG), dem ZuBu, dem KennBu, der EndSZ der Endstelle A und der EndSZ der Endstelle B zusammensetzt. Beispiel: 92Z/1 EG 49/211/79/38 – 49/211/80/38 Langtext-Schreibweise: 92Z/1 EG Düsseldorf 79/38 – Düsseldorf 80/38 <LSZ> / <order number 10 digits with leading zeros> - <EndSzA> - <EndSzB> example: 4C1 / 0000000005-49 / 711/880001 / 7MC1-49 / 911/85 / 7ZJA

lsz.description: Leitungsschlüsselzahl This attribute defines the type of the link. The lsz is part of the lbz (Leitungsbezeichnung). LSZ values used in A4: https://gard.telekom.de/gardwiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=293228420 Note: A link in an FTTB PON tree does not have an lsz.

orderNumber.description: This attribute defines ...? The order number is part of the lbz (Leitungsbezeichnung).

partyId.description: This attribute defines the partyId of the requesting system.

pluralId.description: This attribute contains the identifier of the link in Plural (only FYI for user).

specificationVersion.description: This attribute contains the version of the class specification.

ueWegId.description: Übertragungsweg-ID This attribute contains the unique identificator of the link. (Line-ID?, LSZ?)

lifecycleState.description: This attribute contains the lifecycle state of the network element.

operationalState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

NetworkElementPort.description:
NetworkElementPort within Access 4.0 project
Skipped properties: activationFeature,attachment,note,place,resourceSpecification,value,startOperatingDate,endOperatingDate,administrativeState,resourceStatus,usageState,category,name,resourceVersion,relatedParty

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

creationTime.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

functionalPortLabel.description: This attribute contains an identifier for the port function as defined by the portList:PortSpec from the NetworkElementType catalog.

lastUpdateTime.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

networkElementEndsz.description: This attribute is the Endschlüsselzahl of the related NetworkElement

networkElementUuid.description: This attribute is for search by networkElementUuid

partyId.description: This attribute defines the partyId of the requesting system.

portNumber.description: This attribute defines the portNumber of NetworkElementPort. (This is a part of the functionPortLabel)

portType.description: This attribute defines the type of the NetworkElementPort (usually related to the type of technical interface of the hardware that acts as the NetworkElement). The value is taken from the portList:PortSpec from the NetworkElementType catalog.

specificationVersion.description: This attribute contains the version of the class specification.

administrativeMode.description: This attribute can only be set by the managing system. It is working like a switch and is independent of other states. ENABLED: The underlying resource is allowed to perform its normal duties. DISABLED: The underlying resource isn't allowed to perform any function AND the operationalState is set to NotWorking.

operationalState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

NetworkElements.description:
NetworkElement within Access 4.0 project
Skipped properties: activationFeature,attachment,note,place,resourceSpecification,value,startOperatingDate,endOperatingDate,administrativeState,resourceStatus,usageState,name,resourceVersion,relatedParty

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

address.description: Human readable string of the address identified by the klsId.

category.description: Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

creationTime.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

fsz.description: This attribute contains the functional key number FSZ (Funktionsschlüsselzahl). It identifies the class of the device and at the same time provides the identification of the function of the network element.

klsId.description: KLS - Core Information Object (KIO) Locality Server - is a central reference data server for localities and network locations. It is the master system for holding and changing address and location reference data (also network mapping). See also: https://yam.telekom.de/docs/DOC-482263

lastUpdateTime.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

networkElementGroupUuid.description: This attribute is for the search by networkElementGroupUuid

partyId.description: This attribute defines the partyId of the requesting system.

plannedMatNumber.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

planningDeviceName.description: This attribute contains the device name in the planning context.

specificationVersion.description: This attribute contains the version of the class specification.

type.description: Contains the value of the name attribute of the NE type instance that was used to instantiate the network element.

vpsz.description: This attribute contains the connection node key VPSZ (Verbindungspunktschlüsselzahl). It logically identifies the site where devices and other connections are terminated.

ztpIdent.description: This optional attribute contains the zero-touch-provisioning identifier set by the installation process (the technician doing the installation of the hardware that is targeted to act as this NetworknElement). The value is used to map the identifier received from a technical identification process (e.g. the client identifier / option 61 field in a DHCP request) to the Network Element instance. It must be unique within the NEMO domain.

administrativeMode.description: This attribute can only be set by the managing system. It is working like a switch and is independent of other states. ENABLED: The underlying resource is allowed to perform its normal duties. DISABLED: The underlying resource isn't allowed to perform any function AND the operationalState is set to NotWorking.

lifecycleState.description: This attribute contains the lifecycle state of the network element.

operationalState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

category.description: Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

creationTime.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

endOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date till the resource is operating

lastUpdateTime.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

partyId.description: This attribute defines the partyId of the requesting system.

productionScheme.description: This attribute defines the customer segment of the service.

resourceVersion.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

specificationVersion.description: This attribute contains the version of the class specification.

startOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is operating

value.description: the value of the logical resource. E.g '0746712345' for  MSISDN's

administrativeMode.description: This attribute can only be set by the managing system. It is working like a switch and is independent of other states. ENABLED: The underlying resource is allowed to perform its normal duties. DISABLED: The underlying resource isn't allowed to perform any function AND the operationalState is set to NOT_WORKING.

administrativeState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

lifecycleState.description: This attribute contains the lifecycle state of the network service profile. Note: State RETIRING is not allowed

operationalState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

resourceStatus.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

usageState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

Note.description: Extra information about a given entity

id.description: Identifier of the note within its containing entity (may or may not be globally unique, depending on provider implementation)

NspFtthAccess within Access 4.0 project
Skipped properties: activationFeature,attachment,note,place,resourceSpecification,value,startOperatingDate,endOperatingDate,administrativeState,resourceStatus,usageState,category,name,resourceVersion,relatedParty

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

creationTime.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

lastUpdateTime.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

lineId.description: This attribute contains the line identifier which provides a functional key to the Access Line handled in the OSS.

ontSerialNumber.description: This optional attribute contains - in case of FTTH - the serial number of the ONT (CPE). The number is provided by the cutomer.

partyId.description: This attribute defines the partyId of the requesting system.

productionScheme.description: This attribute defines the customer segment of the service.

specificationVersion.description: This attribute contains the version of the class specification.

terminationPointUuid.description: This attribute is for the search by TP uuid

administrativeMode.description: This attribute can only be set by the managing system. It is working like a switch and is independent of other states. ENABLED: The underlying resource is allowed to perform its normal duties. DISABLED: The underlying resource isn't allowed to perform any function AND the operationalState is set to NOT_WORKING.

lifecycleState.description: This attribute contains the lifecycle state of the network service profile. Note: State RETIRING is not allowed

operationalState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

ResourceRelationship.description: Linked resources to the one instantiate, such as [bundled] if the resource is a bundle and you want to describe the bundled resources inside this bundle; [reliesOn] if the resource needs another already owned resource to rely on (e.g. an option on an already owned mobile access resource) [targets] or [isTargeted] (depending on the way of expressing the link) for any other kind of links that may be useful

relationshipType.description: Type of the resource relationship, such as [bundled] if the resource is a bundle and you want to describe the bundled resources inside this bundle; [reliesOn] if the resource needs another already owned resource to rely on (eg: an option on an already owned mobile access resource) [targets] or [isTargeted] (depending on the way of expressing the link) for any other kind of links that may be useful

ResourceSpecificationRef.description:
Resources are physical or non-physical components (or some combination of these) within an enterprise's infrastructure or inventory. They are typically consumed or used by services (for example a physical port assigned to a service) or contribute to the realization of a Product (for example, a SIM card). They can be drawn from the Application, Computing and Network domains, and include, for example, Network Elements, software, IT systems, content and information, and technology components.
A ResourceSpecification is an abstract base class for representing a generic means for implementing a particular type of Resource. In essence, a ResourceSpecification defines the common attributes and relationships of a set of related Resources, while Resource defines a specific instance that is based on a particular ResourceSpecification.

TerminationPoint.description:
TerminationPoint. within Access 4.0 project
Skipped properties: activationFeature,attachment,note,place,resourceSpecification,value,startOperatingDate,endOperatingDate,administrativeState,resourceStatus,usageState,operationalState,category,name,resourceVersion,relatedParty

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

creationTime.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

lastUpdateTime.description: This optional attribute identifies the DT material number of a physical entity before it is installed. Set by OSS based on the retrieved material number from the PSL system. This allows the OSS to convert/relate the links retrieved from REBELL to functional network element links (NEL).

lockedForNspUsage.description: This attribute defines if further network service profiles can be assigned to the termination point (true = cannot be assigned). Will be set via NEMO-GUI.

partyId.description: This attribute defines the partyId of the requesting system.

specificationVersion.description: This attribute contains the version of the class specification.

state.description: This attribute defines the state of the termination point. The value is defined by A4 and notified to the OSS.

supportedDiagnoses.description: Lists the supported diagnoses. The values are restricted to the diagnoses defined in the diagnosis catalog. The diagnoses catalog is defined by A4 and known in OpDiNG. Note: The diagnoses supported for a service (NSP) are defined by the sum of diagnoses of all TPs associated to the NSP.

supportedDiagnosesVersions.description: comma-separated list of specification version of diagnoses

type.description: This attribute defines the kind of endpoint the termination point is representing.

endDateTime.description: End of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format

startDateTime.description: Start of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format

code.description: Application relevant detail, defined in the API or a common list.

reason.description: Explanation of the reason for the error which can be shown to a client user.

message.description: More details and corrective actions related to the error which can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.description: URI of documentation describing the error.
